headline: Morning Headlines: Supporters of Ukraine rally, pray in Parma; DeWine halts sales of Russian-owned vodka
author: Amanda Rabinowitz
sentences:
DeWine halts sales of Russian-owned vodka
Ohio sued to stop abortion law that could shutter clinics
Police: At least 1 more person sought in Ohio imam's death
Cleveland mayor proposes changes at West Side Market
Supporters of Ukraine rally, pray in Parma
(Ideastream Public Media) -- Ukrainians, U.S. politicians, and Cleveland-area residents gathered at St. Vladimir Ukrainian Orthodox Cathedral in Parma on Sunday as part of a prayer service and rally in support of Ukraine.

Cleveland mayor proposes changes at West Side Market
(Ideastream Public Media) -- Cleveland Mayor Justin Bibb wants to cap rent increases at the West Side Market and allow vendors to sell alcohol as part of a plan to refresh the historic market in Ohio City.

Ohio sued to stop abortion law that could shutter clinics
(AP) — A new lawsuit seeks to block enforcement of an Ohio abortion restriction that included additional licensing requirements the ACLU and Planned Parenthood argue are onerous.

Police: At least 1 more person sought in Ohio imam's death
(AP) — Authorities say at least one more person is being sought following the arrest of a suspect in the shooting death of an Ohio religious leader last year.
Mike DeWine on Saturday ordered the state Commerce Department to stop the purchase and sale of all vodka made by a Russian-owned company in response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

Mohamed Hassan Adam, a longtime imam at Masjid Abu Hurairah mosque on the northeast side of Columbus, was found dead of multiple gunshots in a van on Dec. 24.

Mike DeWine, along with his wife Fran, attended Sunday morning’s church service at St. Andrew Ukrainian Church in Parma.
